verses.verse: Cities of Refuge East of the Jordan Then Moses (Num. 35:6; Deut. 19:2-13; Josh. 20:7-9) set apart three cities on this side of the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun,
(Deut. 19:4) that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unintentionally, without having hated him in time past, and that by fleeing to one of these cities he might live:
(Josh. 20:8) Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
Introduction to God’s Law Now this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
These are the testimonies, the statutes, and the judgments which Moses spoke to the children of Israel after they came out of Egypt,

on this side of the Jordan, (Deut. 3:29) in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel (Num. 21:24; Deut. 1:4) defeated after they came out of Egypt.
And they took possession of his land and the land (Num. 21:33-35) of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, who were on this side of the Jordan, toward the rising of the sun,
(Deut. 2:36; 3:12) from Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, even to Mount Sion (that is, (Deut. 3:9; Ps. 133:3) Hermon),
and all the plain on the east side of the Jordan as far as the Sea of the Arabah, below the (Deut. 3:17) slopes of Pisgah.

The Ten Commandments Reviewed And Moses called all Israel, and said to them: “Hear, O Israel, the statutes and judgments which I speak in your hearing today, that you may learn them and be careful to observe them.
(Ex. 19:5; Deut. 4:23; Mal. 4:4) The LORD our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
The LORD (Jer. 31:32; Matt. 13:17; Heb. 8:9) did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, those who are here today, all of us who are alive.
(Ex. 19:9) The LORD talked with you face to face on the mountain from the midst of the fire.

(Ex. 20:21; Gal. 3:19) I stood between the LORD and you at that time, to declare to you the word of the LORD; for (Ex. 19:16) you were afraid because of the fire, and you did not go up the mountain. He said:
(Ex. 20:2-17; Lev. 26:1; Deut. 6:4; Ps. 81:10) ‘I am the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
(Ex. 20:2, 3; 23:13; Hos. 13:4) ‘You shall have no other gods before Me.
(Ex. 20:4) ‘You shall not make for yourself a carved image—any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth;

you shall not (Ex. 34:7, 14-16; Num. 14:18; Deut. 7:10) bow down to them nor serve them. For I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
(Num. 14:18; Deut. 7:9; Jer. 32:18; Dan. 9:4) but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
(Ex. 20:7; Lev. 19:12; Deut. 6:13; 10:20; Matt. 5:33) ‘You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain.
(Ex. 20:8; Ezek. 20:12; Mark 2:27) ‘Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the LORD your God commanded you.
(Ex. 23:12; 35:2) Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

but the seventh day is the ((Gen. 2:2); Ex. 16:29; (Heb. 4:4)) Sabbath of the LORD your God. In it you shall do no work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your cattle, nor your stranger who is within your gates, that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.

(Deut. 15:15) And remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God brought you out from there (Deut. 4:34, 37) by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

(Ex. 20:12; Lev. 19:3; Matt. 15:4; Eph. 6:2, 3; Col. 3:20) ‘Honor your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, (Deut. 6:2) that your days may be long, and that it may be well with (Deut. 4:40) you in the land which the LORD your God is giving you.
(Ex. 20:13; Matt. 5:21) ‘You shall not murder.
(Ex. 20:14; Mark 10:19; Luke 18:20; (Rom. 13:9); James 2:11) ‘You shall not commit adultery.
(Ex. 20:15; Lev. 19:11; (Rom. 13:9)) ‘You shall not steal.
(Ex. 20:16; 23:1; Matt. 19:18) ‘You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

(Ex. 20:17; (Rom. 7:7; 13:9)) ‘You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife; and you shall not desire your neighbor’s house, his field, his male servant, his female servant, his ox, his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.’

“These words the LORD spoke to all your assembly, in the mountain from the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, with a loud voice; and He added no more. And (Ex. 24:12; 31:18; Deut. 4:13) He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.

The People Afraid of God’s Presence (Ex. 20:18, 19) “So it was, when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders.

And you said: ‘Surely the LORD our God has shown us His glory and His greatness, and (Ex. 19:19) we have heard His voice from the midst of the fire. We have seen this day that God speaks with man; yet he (Deut. 4:33; Judg. 13:22) still lives.
